meanings.sent1: The dark voids of space seemed endless.
meanings.sent2: The room was filled with voids after the furniture was removed.
meanings.sent3: The voids in the puzzle made it impossible to complete.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes stared into the voids of the abandoned building.
meanings.sent5: The voids in the clouds allowed the sun to peek through.

meanings.sent1: She voids the contract due to a breach of agreement.
meanings.sent2: Please void the incorrect transaction and issue a refund.
meanings.sent3: He voids his promise to clean his room every week.
meanings.sent4: The storm voids any plans for a picnic this weekend.
meanings.sent5: The judge voids the decision and orders a retrial.

meanings.definition: Lacking in legal force or effect.
meanings.sent1: The voids document had no signature and was invalid.
meanings.sent2: The contract became voids after the deadline passed.
meanings.sent3: His excuse for being late was voids in the eyes of the teacher.
meanings.sent4: The old law was voids and needed to be updated.
meanings.sent5: The warranty became voids once the product was tampered with.
